page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT IN EARDISLEY
page.content: There is a large{timber}firm in the centre of the village,which covers 25 acres.They are the largest employer in the district,having 92 workers,who travel from Leominster,Hay and Kington.They import wood mostly from Indonesia,Malaya and South America. They hire lorries to bring the wood from Bristol and Liverpool.On average 30 lorries arrive every week.They can store 400,000cu.ft.of wood.The wood is sawn and prepared for joinery manufacturers,lorry body builders,shop fitters and double glazing firms.The waste wood is burned in kilns which are used to dry the wood and some sawdust goes to a local chicken producer for chicken litter. {Tourism}is quite important in the area Recently local farms and houses have started special weekend break holidays.
